com.mapgroup.classificator.utility

Class Utility

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mapgroup.classificator.utility.Utility

  • public class Utility
extends java.lang.Object
    Supplementary class which contains some useful methods used to control and manage files and directories.

      private Utility()

    • Method Detail

      • checkDirectory

        public static void checkDirectory(java.lang.String currDir)
        Checks if the directory with name currDir already exists or not. If the specified directory doesn't exist it creates it.
        Parameters:
        currDir - directory name that will be checked

      • checkMainFolder

        public static void checkMainFolder()
        Checks if the server's main directory exist and if they aren't, it creates them.

        The main directory that will be checked are:

        • /download
        • /conversion
        • /report
        • /dataset

        If one of the specified directory already exists, no operation on it will be done.

      • cleanFolder

        public static void cleanFolder(java.lang.String folderName)
        Removes all the file contained in the folder with name folderName present in the main directory of the server.

        Obviously, if the directory doesn't exists nothing was done.

      • encryptIP

        public static java.lang.String encryptIP(java.lang.String ip)
        Generates an encrypted string starting from the ip address provided to the method. A specific mapping function will be used in order to convert each character that compounds the ip address to a specific letter.
        Parameters:
        ip - ip address that will be converted
        Returns:
        a string which contains only letters

      • getAvailableName

        public static java.lang.String getAvailableName(java.lang.String fileName)
        Checks if the specified file name, fileName, was already present and in this case it retrieves another valid name in the same directory.

        If the specified file name doesn't exist the same file name was returned by the function.

        If there are some other occurrences of the fileName in its directory, the file name generation will follow this rule: #OLD_FILE_NAME(#NUMBER_OF_OCCURRENCES)

        For example if we have this specific directory organization: 

          + myDir/
      - myFile.dat
      - prova.dat
      - test.dat
      - myFile(1).dat
        A call to getAvailableName("C:/myDir/prova.dat") will return "C:/myDir/prova(1).dat"; Instead, getAvailableName("C:/myDir/myFile.dat") will return "C:/myDir/myFile(2).dat";

        The specified fileName must be an absolute path in order to obtain the desired result.

        Parameters:
        fileName - the old path of the file
        Returns:
        the available file name in the specific directory

      • mapChar

        private static char mapChar(char temp)
        Converts the specified character temp to a specific letter.
        Parameters:
        temp - the character to convert
        Returns:
        returns the specific mapped character

      • nonExistsFile

        private static boolean nonExistsFile(java.lang.String fileName)
        Checks if already exists a file with name fileName.

        There is the possibility to pass to the function a single file name or the whole file path and the function will try to control if the specified file already exists or not.

        Parameters:
        fileName - the file path that will be checked
        Returns:
        true if the file exists, false otherwise
